titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Collection of Bookplates by William Edgar Fisher
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Molly E. Dotson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday February 6, 2019 at 00:00

did.unittitle: Collection of Bookplates by William Edgar Fisher
did.abstract: This collection contains bookplates by William Edgar Fisher. Many of these bookplates, which were designed for both individual and institutional patrons, are prints signed and numbered by the artist; many are hand-colored as well. The collection also includes some correspondence by Fisher as well as letters exchanged by later collectors of his work.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Yale Bookplate Collection was formerly housed in Sterling Memorial Library. The collection was incorporated into the Arts of the Book Collection in 1984 and then moved to the Seeley G. Mudd Library in 1990. In 2011, it was transferred to the Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Collection of Bookplates by William Edgar Fisher, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was removed from filing cabinets which housed bookplates by individual artists. It includes materials indicating the provenance of the following collectors: Irene D. Andrews Pace; Warren Hiram Lowenhaupt; Mrs. Smith, Gift of 1959; and Dr. Alfred Brown.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William Edgar Fisher (1872-1956) was born in Wellsville, NY. He studied at Cornell and the Art Institute of Chicago, focusing on architecture and particularly on draughtsmanship. He operated a studio in Fargo, ND, and designed nearly 200 ex-libris between 1898 and 1947. He was a member of the American Society of Bookplate Collectors & Designers and published five portfolios of bookplates.
Bowdoin, W. G. "American Designers of Book-Plates: Wm. Edgar Fisher." In Book-Plates of To-Day , edited by Wilbur Macey Stone, 3-8. New York: Tonnelé & Company, 1902.
"Fisher, William Edgar." In volume I of Who Was Who in American Art, 1564-1975: 400 Years of Artists in America , edited by Peter Hastings Falk. Madison, CT: Sound View Press, 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains bookplates by William Edgar Fisher. These are arranged chronologically according to a checklist published in The Second Year Book of the American Bookplate Society (1920). Many of these bookplates, which were designed for both individual and institutional patrons, are prints signed and numbered by the artist; many are hand-colored as well. The collection also includes some correspondence by Fisher as well as letters exchanged by later collectors of his work.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Numbered Bookplates. II. Correspondence and Ephemera.
